comments:

If you have a lot of projects in your workspace that need to be synchronized, this happens quite often. Can I request that this bug be considered for inclusion in 3.2.1 ?
Are you sure it is this exception and not the one in bug 143808?

Yes .. I've seen the one in bug 143808 as well, but less frequently then this one. I had  another trace of a similar problem a while back but unfortunately lost the log file.

We're in lockdown for 3.2.1 so only stop ship defects are being considered. I had a look at the fix and it is a bit complicated so I don't feel comfortable putting it into 3.2.1 at this stage. However, I'll reopen this as a reminder to put the fix into 3.2.2.

A decision has been made to be very strict about what goes into the 3.2.2 stream. Given that this bug has a work around, it will not be address in 3.2.2. The workaround can be found at this URL:

http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/CVS_FAQ#Synchronizing_has_some_regressions_in_Eclipse_3.2._Why.3F

I am reverting the state to FIXED in 3.3 M2.

Ok, glad someone informed me that you can disable this, as long as you can do this I have no problem with the bug being postponed. This is a serious nightmare when developping on a multicore system. It often causes items to disappear from a synchronize view. 

This is potentially a dangerous situation in which a user would expect the synchronize view to be complete. With most developer machines now probably being Hyperthreaded or Dual core machines, wouldn't it be wiser to change the default in preferences for 3.2.2.
There was no previous mention of such dire consequences. Based on that, I think it is worthwhile to put a fix into 3.2.2.

That would be great of course, but talking as a very active CVS sync user disabling the models seem to be working fine. 

I'm a little afraid that there may be other issues like this lingering that have not popped up yet. bug 143808 was and I did mention in comment #4 that I had another stack trace which was also pretty similar but I unfortunately lost. It seems to me that probably someone should do a quick audit of the classes used in this functionality to make sure they are thread safe. I do realize that your time is precious and an audit may take too much time (I have no idea how many classes we are talking about) for a 3.2.2 timeframe, so perhaps changing the default setting in preferences isn't such a bad idea. But I leave it up to you eclipse guru's to decide ;)
